Package g41.si2022.mvc

Class Controller<V extends View,M extends Model>

java.lang.Object
g41.si2022.mvc.Controller<V,M>
Type Parameters:
V - Type representing the View. This must extend View
M - Type representing the Model. This must extend Model
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConsultarIngresosGastosController, EstadoActividadesController, GestionarCursoController, GestionarFacturasEmprController, GestionarFacturasProfController, GestionarInscripcionesController, GestionarListaEsperaController, InscribirMultiplesUsuariosController, InscribirMultiplesUsuariosEntidadController, InscribirUsuarioController, ListaActividadesController, ModificarCursosController, RegistrarCursoController
public abstract class Controller<V extends View,M extends Model> extends Object

A Controller is the intermediary that joins the data supplied by the Model with the components contained in the View.

This means that a Controller must define all the behaviour of a given screen. Some of the things a controller usually does are:

  • Creating and assigning Listeners.
    • Sending data from the Model to the View.

Author:
Alex // UO281827

    • setNonVolatileLoaded

      public void setNonVolatileLoaded(boolean nonVolatileLoaded)

      DO NOT RUN THIS METHOD.

      This method is only expected to be ran by Tab when this controller's Tab is set to visible the first time.

      The nonVolatileLoaded keeps track of wether the non volatile contents of a View has been loaded or not. Setting this to False will make it so the non volatile contents of the View are loaded again.

      Parameters:
      nonVolatileLoaded - next value for the nonVolatileLoaded flag.
      See Also:
      • View

    • isNonVolatileLoaded

      public boolean isNonVolatileLoaded()
      Checks if the non volatile contents of a View have been loaded or not.
      The fact that this returns false implies that the non volatile contents should be loaded when the next View#setVisible() is ran with true.
      Returns:
      true if the non volatile contents of the View have been loaded, false if the have not.
      See Also:
      • View

    • initNonVolatileData

      public abstract void initNonVolatileData()

      Loads all the NON VOLATILE DATA. This is data that does not get updated / changed throughout the execution of the program.

      This function should add all the Listeners to the components of the View, and fill structures such as JComboBoxes that only contain States.

      This function should only be called ONCE per run.
      See Also:
      • View

    • initVolatileData

      public abstract void initVolatileData()

      Loads all the VOLATILE DATA. This is data that may get upated / change throughout the execution of the program.

      This function should add all the data to JTables as long as this data may be updated by INSERT or UPDATE SQL commands.

      This function should be called EVERY TIME the tab is loaded shown.
